text: Joel Barnett, Baron Barnett, PC (14 October 1923 - 1 November 2014), was a Labour Party politician. As Chief Secretary to the Treasury in the late 1970s, he created the Barnett Formula that fixed the amount of public spending in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Barnett died in Manchester, England, aged 91.Lord Barnett, creator of formula for UK spending allocations, dies, BBC News, 3 November 2014 ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Members of the Cabinet of the United Kingdom Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs
